q1.question: What happens if Draco is killed?
q1.recall: If Draco is killed, Einon will also die.
q1.vectordb: If Draco is killed, Einon would die as well. Their lives are tied together, and as long as Draco lives, Einon is virtually immortal. However, if Draco is killed, Einon's immortality would be vanquished.

q7.question: why Draco begs Bowen to kill him?
q7.answer: ['to vanquish Einon', 'Draco is the last of his kind.', "Bowen to kill him as it is the only way to end Einon's reign."]
q7.recall: Draco begs Bowen to kill him because he longs for death but is scared of losing his soul.
q7.vectordb: Draco begs Bowen to kill him because he believes that by sacrificing himself, he can vanquish Einon, who shares his life force. However, Bowen cannot bring himself to kill Draco because he has come to respect and admire him. In the end, Bowen kills Draco at Einon's request to save Kara's life. Draco's sacrifice ultimately leads to Einon's defeat.
q7.hybrid: Draco begs Bowen to kill him because he believes that by sacrificing himself, he can vanquish Einon, who shares his life force. However, Bowen cannot bring himself to kill Draco because he has come to respect and admire him. In the end, Bowen kills Draco at Einon's request to save Kara's life. Draco's sacrifice ultimately leads to Einon's defeat.
